Post-process¶

Basic post-processing capabilities to get specific values and plot results. Time-dependent data can be obtained for individual isotopes. Two methods are available:

Input

Description

getvalues

Obtain the values of a specific property

Export

Export results to hdf5 file

IsotopicRank

Rank isotopes according to their signficance

plot

Plot time-dependent results

Before the post-processing class is applied, the user must execute a depletion scenario and generate a MainDepletion object.

Load module:

pyIsoDep.functions.postprocessresults import Results

Execution:

res = Results(results)

where,

results is the MainDepletion object.

Note

  • The Results will be very similar to the MainDepletion object, but will contain only the attributes (not the methods inherited from the MainDepletion object).

getvalues¶

Obtain the values of a specific property

res.getvalues(attribute, isotopes)

where,

Input

Description

attribute

The name of the property (provided as a string)

isotopes

A list or array of isotopes provided in ZZAAA0/1 format (e.g., 541351)

Note

  • For the full list of attributes that can exist on the Results container, please see Results container.

  • If the post-irradiation supplementary methods are not executed then some attributes will not exist on the Results object.

Examples:

  • Isotopic density for a specific isotope:

dep = MainDepletion(0.0, data)
res = Results(dep)
res.getvalues("Nt", isotopes=[541350])

  • Decay heat in Watts for multiple isotopes:

res.getvalues("Qt", isotopes=[541350, 942380])

  • Material total values:

res.getvalues("totalQt",)

plot¶

Plot time-dependent results.

res.plot(attribute, timeUnits, isotopes, xlabel, ylabel, norm, fontsize, markers, markerfill, markersize=6, pltType, newFig)

where,

Input

Description

attribute

The name of the property (provided as a string)

timeUnits

String for the units to be used on the x-axis = {“seconds”, “minutes”, “hours”, “days”}

isotopes

A list or array of isotopes provided in ZZAAA0/1 format (e.g., 541351)

xlabel

String for the x-axis label

ylabel

String for the y-axis label

norm

Normalization factor. Should be provided as float. It is used to divide the desired results by the provided factor.

markers

String of List of strings to represent markers. Default is “–^”

markerfill

Boolean flag to indicate whetehr marker fill should be removed. Default is False

markersize

Float that represents the marker size.

pltType

String to represent a plot type: {“linear”, “loglog”, “semilogx”}. Default is “linear”

newFig

Boolean flag to indicate whether a new figure should be created or an existing can be used. Default is True

Note

  • For the full list of attributes that can exist on the Results container, please see Results container.

  • If the post-irradiation supplementary methods are not executed then some attributes will not exist on the Results object.

Examples:

  • Isotopic density for a specific isotope:

dep = MainDepletion(0.0, data)
res = Results(dep)
res.plot("Nt", isotopes=[541350])

  • Decay heat in Watts for multiple isotopes:

res.plot("Qt", isotopes=[531350, 541350], norm=1E+6, ylabel="Total Decay Heat, MW")

  • Non-isotopic total values:

res.plot("flux", ylabel="Flux, n/cm2/s", pltType="semilogx")

IsotopicRank¶

Ranks attribute from most important to least important

res.IsotopicRank(attribute, timepoint=None, timeIdx=None, absFlag=True)

where,

Input

Description

attribute

The name of the property (provided as a string)

timepoint

Specific time point of interest.

timeIdx

Specific time index of interest.

absFlag

Flag to indicate whether the ranking is according to absolute values or not. Default is True.

Note

  • Either timepoint or timeIdx should be provided. If both are provided then the timepoint is search first. If none are provided then the last step is taken for ranking.

Examples:

  • Rank the decay heat according to a specific time-point:

res = Results(dep)
sortIds, sortQts = res.IsotopicRank("Qt", timepoint=30.0)

  • Rank according to BR:

sortIds, sortQts = res.IsotopicRank("BR")

Export¶

To be completed. Spill all results to hhdf5 file.

pyIsoDep
